intro: Meiostemon tetrandrus subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian meiostemon, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers with four stamens, typical of the Myrtaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
